Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by suggesting that there is a video clip in which Barack Obama acknowledges that he is not a natural-born U.S. citizen.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to back up the existence of the video clip.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video clip is genuine and that Barack Obama actually made the statements mentioned in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation by stating that the video clip originated from a humor site that edits and rearranges clips to make it appear as if Obama said things he did not.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Barack Obama was indeed a natural-born U.S. citizen, as confirmed by his birth certificate and other official documents.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting a misleading and edited video clip as evidence, which undermines its credibility.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in this case.
